The Newsgame Design Toolkit

 a game design methodology for the newsroom

It’s dangerous to go alone! Take this.

Welcome to The Newsgame Design Toolkit. This site was created in Spring 2014 as my final project for Ethan Zuckerman’s Future of News and Participatory Media class at MIT. Here, I explore the concept and specific instances of the newsgame, and lay out a basic methodology for creating newsgames. By and large, this is a resource on game design, not game development, but feel free to check the Resources section for more technical assistance. Moreover, this is an opinionated guide that subscribes to a particular vision of the newsgame as well as certain design methodologies.

You can find my original pitch for this project over on the MAS.700 blog. Originally, I was tinkering with the idea of building an actual tool a la The Cartoonist, but this was deemed out of scope. I plan to revisit that concept as a project in the future. Special thanks goes to the Data Journalism Handbook, where much of the inspiration for this format comes from. Note that this is a work in progress, and I’m always looking for contributions from others — if you’re interested in adding content, submit a pull request over on our GitHub repo. If you have no idea what that means, just shoot me an email and we’ll talk.

About

The Newsgame Design Toolkit is a resource created to guide the development of newsgames, synthesizing tried and true methods from the game design process with the storytelling goals of news reporting. This was originally created by Stephen Suen as his final project for MAS.700.

Colophon

Logo icons by Lucas Almeida, Guillaume Berry, and baabullah hasan for The Noun Project.

Site built with Jekyll and Jeet and served via GitHub Pages. Text is set in Brandon Grotesque and served by Typekit.
